title: APA aggregate charts: color differentiation + connectNulls

requirements.text:
In `frontend/src/components/players/ApaAggregateCharts.tsx`, update the Recharts `<Line />` stroke colors (visual-only) exactly as follows, without changing any chart data generation, keys, labels, or computations:
- PPI & aPPI Trend chart:
  - PPI line: `stroke="#000"`, `strokeWidth={2}`
  - aPPI line: `stroke="#2563eb"`, `strokeWidth={2}`
- Match Results chart:
  - Your Points line: `stroke="#000"`, `strokeWidth={2}`
  - Opponent Points line: `stroke="#2563eb"`, `strokeWidth={2}`
  - Defensive Shots line: `stroke="#7c3aed"`, `strokeWidth={2}`
acceptanceCriteria: PPI & aPPI Trend renders PPI in black (#000) and aPPI in blue (#2563eb), both with strokeWidth=2.
Match Results renders Your Points in black (#000), Opponent Points in blue (#2563eb), and Defensive Shots in purple (#7c3aed), all with strokeWidth=2.
No changes are made to data building (e.g., unifiedData), sorting, parsing, filtering, datapoints, averaging, regression, smoothing, or any backend code.

requirements.text: In `frontend/src/components/players/ApaAggregateCharts.tsx`, set `connectNulls={true}` on every Recharts `<Line />` used in both the PPI & aPPI Trend chart and the Match Results chart.
acceptanceCriteria: All five rendered `<Line />` components (PPI, aPPI, Your Points, Opponent Points, Defensive Shots) include `connectNulls={true}`.
Lines render continuously across null/missing values without breaking into segments.
No other behavioral changes are introduced outside this file.

constraints: Do not change or add any data recalculation, new datapoints, averaging, regression, smoothing, or any other math/logic.
Do not change user-facing text (keep existing English labels/titles as-is).
nonGoals: Changing dot shapes, dot colors, legends, chart datasets, axes, tooltips, or any other chart behavior beyond the specified stroke colors and connectNulls.
Any changes to `frontend/src/lib/apa/apaAggregateStats.ts` or any other file.
Any Accepting Gifts, Straight Shot, Match History, routing, or persistence changes.
